thread.title: St Etienne v Manchester United, Europa League LIVE score | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: St Etienne v Manchester United, Europa League LIVE score | Daily Mail Online

author: Dan Ripley For Mailonline
title: St Etienne v Manchester United, Europa League LIVE score | Daily Mail Online
text:
— AS Saint-Etienne (@ASSEofficiel) February 22, 2017 16:06 Wayne Rooney to quit Manchester United: Captain unhappy at reduced role under Jose Mourinho and has been offered £35m China move 
Should he stay or should he go? Wayne Rooney will have The Clash running through his head as he weighs up what is best for his future in the coming weeks, as clubs in the UK, China and the USA hope he picks them. 
The Manchester United striker hasn't played since February 1 and is being widely linked with a move away from Old Trafford, despite having 18 months left on his contract with the Red Devils.Here, Sportsmail breaks down Rooney's potential destinations... 16:00 Manchester United make three changes from the first-leg win 
Zlatan Ibrahimovic's hat-trick is the difference between the sides and the Swedish striker retains his place from the team who defeated St Etienne 3-0 at Old Trafford last Thursday. 
Ander Herrera is suspended for the Red Devils as he is replaced by Michael Carrick, while Ashley Young and Henrikh Mkhitaryan also come into the side at the expense of Antonio Valencia and Anthony Martial. Florentin Pogba (left) of Saint Etienne and Paul Pogba of Manchester United talk before the game The Pogba brothers are set to go face-to-face again in the second leg of the Europa League tie 15:53 
Romero, Young, Smalling, Bailly, Blind, Carrick, Pogba, Fellaini, Mata, Mkhitaryan, Ibrahimovic. 15:48 Wayne Rooney to quit Manchester United: Captain unhappy at reduced role under Jose Mourinho and has been offered £35m China move 
SIMON JONES AND CHRIS WHEELER: Wayne Rooney has decided to quit Manchester United after accepting that his Old Trafford career is coming to an end. 
United’s record goalscorer is unhappy with a reduced role under Jose Mourinho and has told friends he is leaving after nearly 13 years at the club. He is determined to go on his own terms. 
A source told Sportsmail: ‘The writing is on the wall for Wayne. He can see what’s happening. He’s playing less and believes he still has a lot to give. He won’t want to continue here like this.’ 15:41 Seems like those Manchester United banners are getting around a bit Manchester United banners are put up in the city of Saint Etienne before the Europa League clash A flag of St George was also hung in the city ahead of the round of 32 tie Fans mix before the game in front of a banner supporting Manchester United's Marcus Rashford A Saint Etienne supporters looks on as Manchester United supporters put up banners Manchester United will hope to progress to the last-16 of the Europa League 15:33 Here are all of this weeks's second leg Europa League round of 32 ties 
As you can see it's not just Manchester United featuring this evening...
